one_reviews_text: 2-1/2 stars.  I could have spent $3 on worse things like renting Terminator 5 on Amazon again I guess, but I'm having trouble saying this is even good for a once-though.  Short and not particularly interesting to me.  Google Earth which is free, has far more interesting places to explore like Horseshoe Bend and Hoover Dam among many and the images are real, not created.

I can say that they really give you the feel that you're in the Grand Canyon.   It is kind of antimated but still colorful and an enjoyable experience.   I definitely think this is one of the coolest experience in VR that I have encountered.   Definite something that you might comeback to on occasions to experience over and over.

This $3.00 app does exactly what it says - it's a trip down the river in the Canyon.  The scenery is well done, superb, I would say.  A night time and a day time trip is included and both are very enjoyable.  This is not a game, although some interaction is available.  It's very relaxing and peaceful.  Kudos to the developers.  I hope you do more like this!  ... played on a Rift S, 2080ti ...  worked flawlessly!

review_title: Simple VR boat ride but relaxing
one_reviews_text: Overall, it's a nice simple VR boat ride around a small area of the Grand Canyon with a couple of nice vantage point stops and a few animals to encounter along the way. I would have liked to see a few more animals and wished that I could lure that rabbit towards me by offering it some food (like you can with the fish), but it's still a nice little VR experience with decent graphics and is good for relaxation or if you just want to chill out with some peaceful scenery.

I’m not sure how earlier reviewers played this experience, but it took me a good hour to get through. There is a day trip and a night trip and I started with the night trip first. Plenty to do including two lookout points (I missed the first one), listen to the coyotes sing, and admire the full moon. There is also a friendly rabbit that may like to share your fire, and of course, the waterfall!
Day trip is in the opposite direction with butterflies, fish to feed, hawks and other flora and fauna. I understand from previous reviews it was free at one point, but for the price of $2.99 you get a lot of value. Stopping to admire the full moon or other beauty spots is relaxing so is feeding the fish.  
It is a set track you go on and you could get through it much faster than I did if you open the throttle all the way. So milage will vary, but it is a relaxing experience and it’s nice that the flashlight from the night trip returns to the boat faithfully even if you try to lob it into the water to see what happens.

review_title: Not as fast as in my F15 or AH64
one_reviews_text: Nice, Pritty, restful, will use multi times for me, and to demo to family and friends.
I was expecting more than a minimal experience. This just doesn't come up to scratch. Not worth messing about with, try something else.

review_title: Could be better, but it's nice
one_reviews_text:
Those who wish more functions in this are right; The app could need some improvement in the reactions; But it does exactly what it's promising: a boat trip through the Grand Canyon. Of course it would be fun if you could touch things, but for what?
This is a wonderful "goes nowhere, does nothing" VR app, but one should not expect too much action from it. I liked it. PS: It's fun to step outside the boat and watch like swimming in the water; unfortunately, when being under the water, it doesn't look like being under the water.

This is so relaxing, if you ring the bell on the right it's nightime and there is a flashlight to look all around. If you ring the bell on the left its daytime. Not for sure how to feed the fish. The only drawback is when you ring the bells all the way it starts over. But for free, its worth it.

review_title: Nice - but this experience feels dated
one_reviews_text: Two years ago this would have been far more impressive, unfortunately there are many better experiences in VR today. This is basically a 15 minutes 360 degrees video, where you can stop or control the speed. Apart from a flashlight and ringing a few bells there's little to no interaction. Paid $2 for this tech demo, I do not think it's worth more today. Runs perfect using supersampling 2.0 on GTX 1080.

review_title: What is wrong with you who gives one *?
one_reviews_text: A relaxing boat ride set in day or night, with beautiful graphics... even at $10 it is better/longer than many other vr titles. But it is not a game, and doesn't claim to be one.
It's just alright. I was expecting more.

review_title: Nice peaceful VR kayak passenger ride
one_reviews_text: Apparently you can paddle!
review_feedback: You can actually paddle yourself with the stand up paddleboard. Once you arrive at the canyon, sitting in the chair under the tree, look behind you. You will see a paddle. Grab this and you can paddle anywhere you like!

one_reviews_text: A nice boat ride! Very peaceful, good for relaxation.
There aren't many of this kind of relaxing ride/sight seeing tour, I just wish there are more, perhaps in a luscious green forest. Let this be a start.
I enjoy this along with the other - Non-Shoot-EM-up games. :) VR is for everyone, even my 80 yr old Mom!

review_title: Stressed or just love nature? Buy this!
one_reviews_text:
I read the description and expected a relaxing ride through a canyon - and thats what i got!

The experience is well made, graphics and sound are good. The scaling is impressive, the details as well. Lenght is just about right.

Definitely worth the money if you know what you are looking for.

Wished there was more interaction or a way to steer myself.

Bought for €2.99 during the summer sale. Cannot say that I understand the negative reviews. The experience could not be more polished and entertaining if this were a Disney park ride, and there is the added advantage that you can repeat it however many times you like and show it to your family and friends too.
I enjoyed this a lot. I recommend that you keep the boat motor speed at minimum to have time to take in the beautiful sights, feed the fish... and don't forget to ring all the bells!
I had to redo the night ride because the first time I failed to see the flashlight :-)

If you're looking for some meditation, maybe. if you're looking for a good experence, look elsewhere
This expereence was very underwealming. I went inot this expecting a cool little experence where you could relax and take your mind off it all, with a boat and paddles. just you and a lake. Instead you get a motor boat that's on a kiddie track in a circle. It was barley worth the 2 bux i paid for it :\. If you're looking for some meditation, maybe. if you're looking for a good experence, look elsewhere
Some of us oldies enjoyed it very much. Considering the price, I rate it as a nice VR experience

For the purpose of clearing your mind, escaping into a peaceful environment, this is great. The night view lets you see the stars, fireflies, and a glowing moon. The day view lets you gaze in awe at the rock formations. It is catharctic, meditative. To make this better, I would like to see a larger area to explore and more than one path.
Reflections have been broken for months and they're headache inducing. Wanted something to show friends/family, but it remains broken.
review_feedback: Hi wwwGhost, very sorry to hear that. Could you send us a bit more information about this (include screenshots and your pc specs) so we can take a look into this? Thanks!  Support@immersiveent.com

one_reviews_text: I was scepical at the beggining because of the bad reviews. Great balade in a canoe along the grand canyon. I enjoyed it. I bought it on sales, that's why I'm giving an extra star otherwise might be expensive if it's an experience you're the only one to benefit from.

I don't know what the heck people expected from this game, and why it got such low reviews, because it was super fun for me. The environment is so well designed, the sound is on points, i mean holy moly you get a feel that you're actually there. Immersion, that's what this game gives you. Sure it's not Robo Recall caliber, but it's a very respectable experience. Try the night node too, so peaceful, so beautiful

If you can grab it for cheap, it's ok. There's nothing in particular to do, which is unfortunate, and it doesn't seem like much has been added from the time I bought it in early access to actual release. But the graphics are fairly good if you want a relaxing on the rails experience.

The graphics look pretty good compared to some. The experince is nice. Lasts about 10 minutes (dependant on how fast you want to go). Makes me want to kayak the Grand Canyon. To me only worth about $3 or $4, not much more.

This was an excellent way to experience the splendor of the Grand Canyon. It would be nice if there were more paths to take and more places to explore of the Grand Canyon. A lot of potential here if the developers add more to it. A great start.
For those looking for more slower relaxing VR experiences this is for you.  But it's not all that long or worth going back to much.

The biggest problem with this is it's not interactive--you can't control what path you take. But the developer is still working on this and has added features like translucent water effects with fish you can see and Touch support. I heard something about randomly generated maps that are always different being possible--I would like to see something like that in the future.
it even has| Touch Suport, Must Have Experience scialy when on sale, i own it on steam and on Oclus Store!
I couldn't make it all the way through without being bored to tears. Not worth it if it were free. Would have to pay me to play it.
As VR experiences about piles of rocks go, this is cosmic, now I am off to watch some cricket whilst listening to Coldplay, all in all I will sleep well tonight.

review_title: What are you supposed to do here?
one_reviews_text: there are these weird hands in the way that idk what to do with. i know that this is a wip but the price for this game is silly.
Nothing mindblowing but insteresting for the price. Trabel down the grand canyon and enjoy the view.
